      std::unordered_map<string, int> additionalWhitelist;
  
      void initializeAdditionalWhitelist() {
        unordered_map<string, int> um = { { "userName", 1 }, { "storeName", 1 }, { "svcSessionToken", 1 } };
        additionalWhitelist = um;
      }

      client(const char* _host,
        const char* _servicePath, const char* _esetServicePath,
        const char* _user,
        const char* _password,
        std::map<string, string>& _customHeaders) : durian::client<socketType>(_host, _servicePath, _user, _password, _customHeaders) {
  
        esetServicePath = _esetServicePath;

initialize additional whitelist

 
        this->initializeAdditionalWhitelist();

initialize thread pool this->setupWaiters();

 
      }
  
      explicit client(const char* _host,
        const char* _servicePath, const char* _esetServicePath, const char* _dataManagementServicePath, const char* _searchPathServicePath,
        const char* _user,
        const char* _password,
        std::map<string, string>& _customHeaders) : durian::client<socketType>(_host, _servicePath, _user, _password, _customHeaders) {
        
        esetServicePath = _esetServicePath;
        dataManagementServicePath = _dataManagementServicePath;
        searchServicePath = _searchPathServicePath;

initialize additional whitelist

 
        this->initializeAdditionalWhitelist();

initialize thread pool this->setupWaiters();

 
      }

override loginResponse b/c response is different

 
      std::function<string(boost::future<std::string>)> loginResponse(shared_ptr<Plustache::Context> ctx) override {
        return [&](boost::future<std::string> f) ->string{
          auto res = f.get();
          
          auto raw = getResponse(res);
          int hasError = checkResponseForError(raw);

TODO: if there's an error, handle it

 
          if (hasError > 0) {
            ctx->add("loginResponse", raw);
            durian::addToLog(MODULE, ctx, "loginXml");
            durian::addToLog(MODULE, ctx, "loginResponse");
            return "";
          }
  
          auto tok = getToken(res);

remove previous token if exist

 
          ctx->remove("svcSessionToken");
          ctx->add("svcSessionToken", tok);
          return tok;
        };
      }
      
      shared_ptr<Plustache::Context> click::client<socketType>::Login() {

override headers

 
        std::map<string, string> customHeaders1 = { { "Content-Type", "text/xml" }, { "SOAPAction", CLICK_NAMESPACE + "Login" } };

get a login future

 
        auto login = this->apiClient->methodPromise["POST"];

get login template

 
        auto loginXml = this->generator.render(ctx, "tpl/click/Login", "tpl/click/root");

start the promises

 
        auto promises = login(servicePath, *loginXml, customHeaders1)
          .then(loginResponse(this->ctx));
  
        promises.get();
  
        return ctx;
      }

        return ctx;
      }
  
      shared_ptr<Plustache::Context> click::client<socketType>::GetEntityByID(const string poRefStr) {

cout << poRefStr << "already downloaded " << endl;

 
          return ctx;
        }

override headers

 
        std::map<string, string> customHeaders1 = { { "Content-Type", "text/xml" }, { "SOAPAction", CLICK_NAMESPACE + "Login" } };

get a login future

 
        auto login = this->apiClient->methodPromise["POST"];

get login template

 
        auto loginXml = this->generator.render(ctx, "tpl/click/Login", "tpl/click/root");

start the promises

 
        auto promises = login(servicePath, *loginXml, customHeaders1)
          .then(loginResponse(this->ctx))
          .then(getEntityByID(this->ctx, "tpl/click/entityServices/getEntityByID", "tpl/click/root", poRefStr))
          .then(getEntityByIDResponse(poRefStr));
          .then(logout(this->ctx, "tpl/click/Logout", "tpl/click/root"))
          .then(logoutResponse());

wait

 
        auto resp = promises.get();
  
        return ctx;
      }
  
      shared_ptr<Plustache::Context> click::client<socketType>::GetEntityByIDAsync(const string poRefStr) {

if (this->ctx->getSafe(poRefStr + "Result").front()[poRefStr + "Result"].size() > 0) { return ctx; }

durian::Map* a; 
        std::unordered_map<std::string, string>::const_iterator a;
        spinlock.lock();

a = this->hashTable.find(poRefStr.c_str());

 
        this->hashTable2.find(poRefStr);
        spinlock.unlock();

if (a) {

 
        if (a != this->hashTable2.end()) {
          return ctx;
        }
  
        boost::promise<string> p;
        boost::future<string> f = p.get_future();
        p.set_value("");
        auto promises = f
          .then(getEntityByID(this->ctx, "tpl/click/entityServices/getEntityByID", "tpl/click/root", poRefStr))
          .then(getEntityByIDAsyncResponse(poRefStr));
  
        promises.get();
  
        return ctx;
      }

      shared_ptr<Plustache::Context> click::client<socketType>::InvokeDataManagement(const string action, const string requestXmlString) {

override headers

 
        std::map<string, string> customHeaders1 = { { "Content-Type", "text/xml" }, { "SOAPAction", CLICK_NAMESPACE + "Login" } };

get a login future

 
        auto login = this->apiClient->methodPromise["POST"];

get login template

 
        auto loginXml = this->generator.render(ctx, "tpl/click/Login", "tpl/click/root");

add to the context for debugging

 
        this->ctx->add("loginXml", *loginXml);

start the promises

 
        auto promises = login(servicePath, *loginXml, customHeaders1)
          .then(loginResponse(this->ctx))
          .then(invokeDataManagement(this->ctx, "tpl/click/dataManagementServices/Generic", "tpl/click/root", action, requestXmlString))
          .then(invokeDataManagementResponse())
          .then(logout(this->ctx, "tpl/click/Logout", "tpl/click/root"))
          .then(logoutResponse());

wait

 
        auto resp = promises.get();
  
        return ctx;
      }

      static string getToken(string res) {
        auto raw = xml2json(res.c_str());

parse the message

 
        rapidjson::Document d;
        d.Parse(raw.c_str());

durian::dumpPrettyJson("getToken.json", d); get the token from the message

 
        auto tok = d["Envelope"]["Body"]["LoginResponse"]["LoginResult"].GetString();
        
        return string(tok);
      }

TODO make sure this is correct

 
      int checkResponseForError(string& raw) {
        int hasError = 0;
        struct json_token *arr, *tok;
        arr = parse_json2(raw.c_str(), raw.size());
        if (!arr) {
          return 1;
        }

Envelope.Body.Fault.detail.ECMServiceExceptionElement.errorMessage

 
        tok = find_json_token(arr, "Envelope.Body.Fault.faultstring");
        if (tok) {
          string a(tok->ptr, tok->len);
          raw = a;
          hasError = 1;
        }
        tok = find_json_token(arr, "html");
        if (tok) {
          string a(tok->ptr, tok->len);
          raw = a;
          hasError = 1;
        }
        free(arr);
        return hasError;
      }

GetEntityByID response

 
      std::function<string(boost::future<std::string>)> getEntityByIDResponse(const string poRefStr) {
        return [&, poRefStr](boost::future<std::string> fut)->string{
          auto res = fut.get();
          auto raw = getResponse(res);

durian::dumpFile("CLICK_GETENTITYBYID_RESPONSE", raw.c_str()); check for error

 
          int hasError = checkResponseForError(raw);

save response in the context, this will be used by the caller the XML, not the JSON ctx->add(poRefStr + "Result", res); cout << res << endl;

 
          ctx->addSafe(poRefStr, raw);

log what was received

 
          durian::addToLog(MODULE, ctx, (char*)poRefStr.c_str());
          return raw;
        };
      }

      std::function<string(boost::future<std::string>)> getEntityByIDAsyncResponse(const string poRefStr) {
        return [&, poRefStr](boost::future<std::string> fut)->string{
          auto res = fut.get();
          auto raw = getResponse(res);

durian::dumpFile("CLICK_GETENTITYBYID_RESPONSE", raw.c_str()); check for error

 
          int hasError = checkResponseForError(raw);

copy string copy = string(raw); save response in the context, this will be used by the caller

 
          spinlock.lock();

hashTable.add(poRefStr.c_str(), raw.c_str());

 
          hasTable2[poRefStr] = raw;
          spinlock.unlock();
          return raw;
        };
      }

      std::function<string(boost::future<std::string>)> getEntitySetElements(shared_ptr<Plustache::Context> ctx, const string bodyTpl, const string rootTpl, const string entitySetPORef, const string poRefsOnly) {

update the SOAP action (SOAPAction was deprecated in soap12, but Click still errors)

 
          std::map<string, string> customHeaders1 = { { "Content-Type", "text/xml" }, { "SOAPAction", CLICK_NAMESPACE + "getEntitySetElements" } };

the session token is already stored in the context (ctx)

          localCtx->add("entitySetPORef", entitySetPORef);
          localCtx->add("poRefsOnly", poRefsOnly);

          ctx->addSafe("getEntitySetElementsXml:" + entitySetPORef, *getEntitySetElementsXml);

          return f2.get();
        };
      }

      std::function<string(boost::future<std::string>)> invokeDataManagement(shared_ptr<Plustache::Context> ctx, const string bodyTpl, const string rootTpl, const string action, const string requestXmlString) {

        ctx->remove("InvokeDataManagementResponse");

update the SOAP action (SOAPAction was deprecated in soap12, but Click still errors)

 
          std::map<string, string> customHeaders1 = { { "Content-Type", "text/xml" }, { "SOAPAction", CLICK_NAMESPACE + action } };

          auto future2 = apiClient->methodPromise["POST"];

          return f2.get();
        };
      }

UpdateResponse (DataManagementService)

 
      std::function<string(boost::future<std::string>)> invokeDataManagementResponse() {
        return [&](boost::future<std::string> fut)->string{
          auto res = fut.get();
          auto raw = getResponse(res);

check for error

 
          ctx->add("InvokeDataManagementResponseHasError", "false");
          int hasError = checkResponseForError(raw);
          if (hasError) {
            ctx->remove("InvokeDataManagementResponseHasError");
            ctx->add("InvokeDataManagementResponseHasError", "true");
          }

save response in the context, this will be used by the caller the XML, not the JSON

 
          ctx->add("InvokeDataManagementResponse", res);

log what was received

 
          durian::addToLog(MODULE, ctx, "InvokeDataManagementResponse");
          return raw;
        };
      }
